passage: While researching a topic, a student has taken the following notes: • Ada Lovelace was an English mathematician and writer. • She is known for her work on Charles Babbage's early mechanical general-purpose computer, the Analytical Engine. • Ada Lovelace's notes on the engine include what is recognized as the first algorithm intended to be processed by a machine. • Because of her contributions to the field of computer science, she is often regarded as the world's first computer programmer.
question: Which choice most effectively uses relevant information from the notes to emphasize Ada Lovelace's contribution to computer science?

choices.A: Ada Lovelace was an English mathematician who worked on Charles Babbage's Analytical Engine.
choices.B: Ada Lovelace is often considered the world's first computer programmer due to her development of the first machine-readable algorithm.
choices.C: Ada Lovelace's notes on the Analytical Engine include an algorithm intended to be processed by a machine.
choices.D: Ada Lovelace collaborated with Charles Babbage on the development of the Analytical Engine.

explanation: B: 'Ada Lovelace is often considered the world's first computer programmer due to her development of the first machine-readable algorithm.' is the correct answer because it effectively emphasizes Ada Lovelace's contribution to computer science by highlighting her role in developing the first machine-readable algorithm.
distractor_explanation: 'Ada Lovelace was an English mathematician who worked on Charles Babbage's Analytical Engine.' is incorrect because it does not specifically mention her contribution to computer science.

'Ada Lovelace's notes on the Analytical Engine include an algorithm intended to be processed by a machine.' is incorrect because it does not emphasize her status as the world's first computer programmer.
'Ada Lovelace collaborated with Charles Babbage on the development of the Analytical Engine.' is incorrect because it does not focus on her specific contribution to computer science.
